name: Contact Form 7 Group Mail
author: Augusto Bennemann

sections.description:
Contact Form 7 Group Mail allows you to send messages to multiple users, according to their groups. With this plugin you can choose who (admins, editors, authors, contributors, subscribers and custom roles) are going to receive the e-mails.

The list of recipients is automatically updated, so it’s not needed to change the contact form every time a user is added or removed.

Important: it is an extension for Contact Form 7 plugin.
sections.installation:
1. Upload ‘contact-form-7-group-mail’ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory
  2. Create or edit a ‘Contact Form 7’ form.
  3. Go to ‘Group Mail’ and select groups to receive the e-mails.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload ‘contact-form-7-group-mail’ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory
  2. Create or edit a ‘Contact Form 7’ form.
  3. Go to ‘Group Mail’ and select groups to receive the e-mails.

Is it possible to use different configurations for each form?

Yes! Individual configuration is available.

Can I send the messages to a group that I created?

Yes, it works with custom roles.

Does it send ‘Cc’ and ‘Bcc’ e-mails?

Yes. It’s possible since version 0.9

What version of Contact Form 7 I need?

This plugin requires Contact Form 7 4.2 or later.
sections.changelog:
1.7

  • Bcc and Cc are working again

1.5.2

  • Bug fixed: Bcc working again

1.5

  • This version is compatible with Contact Form 7 4.2

1.3

  • Fixed bugs in WP 3.8 and CF7 3.6

1.1.7

  • Added translation support.

1.1.5

  • Individual configuration available

1.1

  • Individual configuration available

1.0

  • Works with custom roles

0.9

  • Added “Cc” and “Cco” options

0.8

  • Added ‘contributors’ option.
  • Lighter code.

short_description: Allows you to send Contact Form 7 messages to any group (admins, editors, authors, contributor, subscribers and custom roles).
description:
Contact Form 7 Group Mail allows you to send messages to multiple users, according to their groups. With this plugin you can choose who (admins, editors, authors, contributors, subscribers and custom roles) are going to receive the e-mails.

The list of recipients is automatically updated, so it’s not needed to change the contact form every time a user is added or removed.

Important: it is an extension for Contact Form 7 plugin.

upgrade_notice.1.7: • VERY IMPORTANT UPGRADE. Bcc and Cc modes are fixed in this version.
upgrade_notice.1.5.2: • Important bug fixed: Bcc is working again.
upgrade_notice.1.5: • This version is compatible with Contact Form 7 4.2
upgrade_notice.1.1.5: If you installed 1.1, please update! This version allows individual configuration. IMPORTANT: Global configuration isn't available anymore, so the active configuration will be set to all forms.
upgrade_notice.1.1: This version allows individual configuration. IMPORTANT: Global configuration isn't available anymore, so the active configuration will be set to all forms.
upgrade_notice.1.0: This version allows you to use custom roles.
upgrade_notice.0.9: This version adds "Cc" and "Cco" options to plugin.
upgrade_notice.0.8: This version adds a new 'contributors' option to plugin and is lighter.

screenshots.caption: Multiple usage: sending emails to users.
